title: Understand the Binomial Theorem
text: The Binomial Theorem provides a way to expand binomials that are raised to a power. Understanding this theorem can help you systematically break down and expand expressions like $${\left(4a-b\right)}^3$$.

title: Identify the Formula
text: The general form for binomial expansion of $${\left(x+y\right)}^n$$ involves terms with coefficients from Pascal's Triangle, powers of $$x$$ and $$y$$, and the sum of the powers equaling $$n$$. Can you recall how that aligns with the given expression?

title: Calculate the Coefficients
text: Use the coefficients from Pascal's Triangle for the expansion: For the third row (since $$n=3)$$, the coefficients are $$1$$, $$3$$, $$3$$, $$1$$.

title: Determine the First Term in the Expansion
text: Calculate the first term: $${\left(4a\right)}^3$$. What does this term simplify to?

title: Determine the Second Term in the Expansion
text: Calculate the second term using the binomial coefficients: $$3{\left(4a\right)}^2 {\left(-b\right)}^1$$. What does this term simplify to?

title: Determine the Third Term in the Expansion
text: Calculate the third term: $$3{\left(4a\right)}^1 {\left(-b\right)}^2$$. What does this term simplify to?

title: Determine the Fourth Term in the Expansion
text: Calculate the fourth term: $${\left(-b\right)}^3$$. What does this term simplify to?

title: Combine All Terms
text: Combine all simplified terms to complete the binomial expansion.
